result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin T. Langerud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Pay restitution of $1,572.00.
Court finds the defendant has the ability to pay.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin T. Langerud appears by phone from Stanley Correctional. David R. Knaapen appeared for Louis Molepske Jr. on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.

9:35 am  Court calls the case and states the appearance.
This is before the Court for a review.  Defendant wrote a letter.

Court questions Defendant.
Defendant responds.
Court questions Defendant re: the Statute that says money cannot be taken out for gifts.
Defendant responds.
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Court reviews the JOC and states its findings.
Defendant will receive a copy of the minutes.
Defendant to talk to the prison officials regarding why 50% is being taken out.
Motion hearing on September 6, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Justin T. Langerud not in court. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:54 pm  Court calls case.

Court addresses the issues.
Court states that the Defendant is in prison and was not set up to appear by video.

BY THE COURT:
Court will reschedule for another day.
Review hearing on August 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Justin T. Langerud
Current: 100 Corrections Drive, c/o Stanley Correctional, Stanley, WI 54768-6500 United States  (Effective: 10-29-2014)
Prior: 1971 Green Tree Drive, Plover, WI 54467
letter from defendant in re:  motion filed (not received in COC Office) copy of letter and JOC sent to DA & Br 3 on 06/16/16 sp
Sentencing Hearing held 6/19/15
Denying Defendant's Petition for Eligibility to Earned Release Program /s/ TTF 11/19/15

Defendant Justin T. Langerud in court with attorney Chris M. Lummis. Defendant Justin T. Langerud in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:45 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 
Both cases heard: 14CF357, 14CF404

Court and both counsel have received the PSI.  
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.  Victims are not present. 
Court notes there is a written statement and the restitution summary. 
Atty Lummis received a copy of the restitution summary this morning.  

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Lummis makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
14CF357 Count 1 - 
12 years prison with 5 years initial confinement followed by 7 years extended supervision

14CF404 Burglary - 
Count 1 - 10 years prison with 5 years intial confinement followed by 5 years extended supervision concurrent with 14CF357

14CF404 Theft - 
6 years prison with 3 years initial confinement followed by 3 years extended supervision, concurrent with Count 1 and 14CF357

CONDITIONS:
Comply with any treatment he has received while confined and any aftercare treatment program that is being prescribed. If he does not, then he will have to have an AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All prescriptions from one pharmacy.
Sign all necessary releases of information forms so the department can monitor these conditions. 
Work fulltime, go to school fulltime or a combination thereof. 
Pay restitution of $1,572.00. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Court finds the defendant has the ability to pay. 
Submit a DNA sample. 
25% of monies shall go towards the restitution first and then fine and costs.  All remaining amounts payable as a condition of extended supervision. 
Not associate with persons possessing/consuming controlled substances without a prescription. 
Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assesment and Department of Corrections. 
No contact with any of the victims or the victims family members with the exception that he write a letter of apology to the Peters family.  That goes to the agent to screen for its sincerity and appropriateness and to talk to the victims as to whether or not they wish to receive it. 
Receive treatment for anger management while confined, if not during his confinement, then he is to do so while on extended supervision. 

Atty Molepske requests anger management. 
Court agrees. 

BY THE COURT: 
276 days of jail credit. 
Court advises determinate sentence form and appellate rights. 
Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs. 

Parties retain their copies of the PSI reports, confidentially. 

Atty Lummis makes statements re: firearms and voting rights. 
Court notes that was done at the time the plea was taken.
Sentencing hearing at 06-19-2015 08:30 am
Sentencing hearing on May 27, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on April 30, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

3:08 p.m. Defendant Justin T. Langerud in court with attorney Chris M. Lummis. Defendant Justin T. Langerud in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CAses 14CF357 and 14CF404 are heard today.  Amended Information filed for 14CF357 and waived reading.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. 14CF357 amended count 1: 14CF404 Count 2 & 3:
 Prison sentences. Requests PSI report.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
No Contest for 14CF357 amended count 1 and14CF404 Count 1 & 2.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

Victim has been notified.
BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF357 amended count 1 and14CF404 Count 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
  14CF357 Cts 2 & 3, and 14CF404 cts 3 & 4 are Dismissed Read In.

BY THE COURT:****PSI Report is ordered.  PSI to be completed by 04-16-15 with copies forward to parties.

Bond is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Plea hearing on March 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justin T. Langerud in court with attorney Chris M. Lummis. Defendant Justin T. Langerud in custody. Louis Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Justin T. Langerud in court with attorney Chris M. Lummis. Defendant Justin T. Langerud in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Constable makes statements.  Defendant wishes to have another Court hear this matter. 
Atty Lummis concurs.  Asks the Judge to recuse himself.    Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant agrees. 

BY THE COURT:  By agreement of the parties, time limits are waived.  Matter is rescheduled.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Lummis
Preliminary hearing on November 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

No contact with Dwayne Peters, Renee Peters, Lacie Firkus and M.D.P.
